headline.main: BIG AXIS SHIPS HIT AT TRIPOLI BY R.A.F.; Raiders Also Strafe Troops and Destroy 5 Seaplanes in Attack on Harbor DOGFIGHT TOLL PUT AT 7 Vicious Battle in Libya Saves British Ships -- Italians List 2 Destroyers as Sunk

lead_paragraph: CAIRO, Egypt, July 1 -- Several large ships, one about 20,000 tons, were damaged during a series of fierce bombing raids yesterday on Tripoli harbor, it was announced today. The superstructure of one ship blew up after a number of bombs hit the deck, and another was seen in a half sunken condition, it was added.
abstract: RAF raids Axis shipping, Tripoli harbor; machine-gun Axis troops; occupation of Ghimbi, Ethiopia, results in capture of many prisoners and supplies; Alexandria raided; Germans claim much damage; Itals claim 2 Brit destroyers sunk, Eastern Mediterranean

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: MEDITERRANEAN, AFRICAN, BALKAN AND NEAR EAST AREAS
